title: Data Visualisation with Python
content:
Module 3, Lesson 6: Data Visualisation with Python

Introduction

Data visualisation transforms numbers into visual insights. Python's Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly ecosystem is the global standard for data scientists.

Key Concepts

1. Matplotlib: the foundation of Python visualisation

Understanding Matplotlib: the foundation of Python visualisation is foundational to this topic. Indian companies and research institutions apply these principles in production AI systems every day.

2. Seaborn: statistical visualisation made easy

Seaborn: statistical visualisation made easy forms the core methodology for practitioners. India's tech ecosystem from Bengaluru to Hyderabad deploys these approaches at scale.

3. Plotly: interactive web charts

Plotly: interactive web charts is critical for building reliable AI solutions. Top Indian firms like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and startups like Razorpay all leverage these techniques.

4. Choosing the right chart type

Mastering Choosing the right chart type separates good practitioners from great ones. Apply these concepts on Indian open datasets from data.gov.in to build hands-on expertise.

Summary

This lesson covered Matplotlib: the foundation of Python visualisation, Seaborn: statistical visualisation made easy, Plotly: interactive web charts, and Choosing the right chart type. These are the building blocks of data visualisation with python — master them through practice on real Indian datasets.
